intro: Crepidomanes venulosum, commonly known as the veined sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features simple, linear leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species in certain regions.
